channel.title: Custom player skins
channel.description:
ok. does anyone know how they work? like when u go to a smp when you log in everyone on the server gets a link to our playerskin so they see u have a custom skin, or is the image sent to the server and resent to everyone? i ran my client from the command line and got some output: [code]Loading texture http://www.minecraft.net/skin/Player.png and java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL: http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftSkins/Player.png[/code] so i was wondering if i did something like bcel or something that i could edit that part to either load the png locally or from a web server that i run. or if that even has anything to do with you custom skin(i was thinking you could change the default skin in the minecraft jar but i dont think everyone would see the change; only you would.). Let me have feedback its just a thought. edit: i get "http://www.minecraft.net/skin/Player.png" b/c i dont have my name changed, and i get "java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL: http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftSkins/Player.png" b/c thats where "http://www.minecraft.net/skin/Player.png" is redirected, and u get access denied. i found this out so far.
minecraft class: bs method: public bs contains bv = new StringBuilder().append ("http://www.minecraft.net/skin/").append (var_eh.b).append (".png").toString(); change http://www.minecraft.net/skin/ to your own website for custom skin, thru bcel or something
well im g2g bb tomorrow.

item.title: Custom player skins
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:14, topic:380146”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=475988.msg3481700#msg3481700 date=1296194697]

thats what was thinking mitb. but if all the ppl playing the server had an edited client to look for the skin on another website then others could see it.

That’s right, everyone would have to use the same modified client.
[/quote]Hey that’s accualy a very nice idea![/quote]

You could also disable the login checking, allowing the player to head straight to the main menu ?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom player skins
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

xryz:

thats what was thinking mitb. but if all the ppl playing the server had an edited client to look for the skin on another website then others could see it.

That’s right, everyone would have to use the same modified client.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom player skins
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:380146”][quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=475988.msg3481317#msg3481317 date=1296162908]

I’m fairly confident that player skins are handled client-side, which means you can edit your client to let you or others have custom skins, but you would have to set them up individually and only you would be able to see them. Pretty useless.
[/quote]I don’t know but i do think the client sends a picture URL to the server wich sends that URL to the other players so they can see you’re skin.
This might be the reason skins could load bad with slow internet.

The client’s don’t send a picture URL, because all of the pictures are at:

http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftSkins/.png

And all clients just grab that one, if it doesn’t exist, they use the default one.[/quote]

stupid notch making hackproof skins o well i own my acc so im fine

Read full topic

item.title: Custom player skins
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:380146”][quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=475988.msg3481317#msg3481317 date=1296162908]

I’m fairly confident that player skins are handled client-side, which means you can edit your client to let you or others have custom skins, but you would have to set them up individually and only you would be able to see them. Pretty useless.
[/quote]I don’t know but i do think the client sends a picture URL to the server wich sends that URL to the other players so they can see you’re skin.
This might be the reason skins could load bad with slow internet.

The client’s don’t send a picture URL, because all of the pictures are at:

http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftSkins/.png

And all clients just grab that one, if it doesn’t exist, they use the default one.[/quote]hmm yeah, too bad :S

Read full topic

item.title: Custom player skins
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:8, topic:380146”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=475988.msg3481314#msg3481314 date=1296162819]
I’m fairly confident that player skins are handled client-side, which means you can edit your client to let you or others have custom skins, but you would have to set them up individually and only you would be able to see them. Pretty useless.
[/quote]I don’t know but i do think the client sends a picture URL to the server wich sends that URL to the other players so they can see you’re skin.
This might be the reason skins could load bad with slow internet.[/quote]

The client’s don’t send a picture URL, because all of the pictures are at:

http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftSkins/.png

And all clients just grab that one, if it doesn’t exist, they use the default one.

Read full topic

so i was wondering if i did something like bcel or something that i could edit that part to either load the png locally or from a web server that i run. or if that even has anything to do with you custom skin(i was thinking you could change the default skin in the minecraft jar but i dont think everyone would see the change; only you would.). Let me have feedback its just a thought.

edit: i get “http://www.minecraft.net/skin/Player.png” b/c i dont have my name changed, and i get “java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL: http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftSkins/Player.png” b/c thats where “http://www.minecraft.net/skin/Player.png” is redirected, and u get access denied. i found this out so far.
